intro: Cassebeera andromedifolia var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender cassebeera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lanceolate leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
